'Water level' or 'ga(u)ge height' or 'stage' is the elevation of the free
surface of a stream, lake or reservoir relative to a specified datum. ISO
772: 1996. Hydrometric determinations â Vocabulary and symbols.

A 'water level' is a device used for matching elevations of locations that are
too far apart for a spirit level to span. The simplest water level is a section
of clear tubing, partially filled with water. Water is easily procured for use,
and easily discarded after use. The ends are held vertical, and the rest of the
tubing lies on the ground or floor. The water level at each end of the tube will
be at the same elevation, whether the two ends are adjacent or far
apart. http://www.deckmagazine.com/article/64.html Making and Using a Water
Level Water levels have been used for many years. The water level is lower-
tech than the laser level, but it can be more accurate over long distances. To
avoid error, all of the water should be at the same temperature. Other sources
of error include difficulty reading due to meniscus.

If the water level is used often, dye can be added to the water to make it
easier to see. If the water level is used outdoors in winter, antifreeze can be
added to the water.
